abstract: Amazon reveals more problems with a warehouse as it prepares to announce its third-quarter earnings.
snippet: Amazon reveals more problems with a warehouse as it prepares to announce its third-quarter earnings.
lead_paragraph: After the close of the stock market Tuesday, Amazon.com will announce its third-quarter results. Analysts are predicting yet another revenue blowout, up 44 percent compared with last year. Amazon's torrid growth more than 15 years after its founding makes it an object of envy and fear across the retail world. It is now a $100 billion company, about 12 times the value of Sears.
